summary: Improper payments—those made by the federal government to the wrong person, in the wrong amount, or for the wrong reason—are a significant problem. In fiscal year 2019, government-wide improper payment estimates totaled about $175 billion. The law requires certain agencies to develop and monitor ways to reduce improper payments and take corrective actions to target their root causes. However, 2 agencies we reviewed did not...
title: Payment Integrity: Selected Agencies Should Improve Efforts to Evaluate Effectiveness of Corrective Actions to Reduce Improper Payments
